verses.verse: And the Ziphites<WH2130> came<WH935> unto Saul<WH7586> to Gibeah<WH1390>, saying<WH559>, Does not David<WH1732> hide<WH5641> himself in the hill<WH1389> of Hachilah<WH2444>, which is before<WH6440> Jeshimon<WH3452>?

And Saul<WH7586> pitched<WH2583> in the hill<WH1389> of Hachilah<WH2444>, which is before<WH6440> Jeshimon<WH3452>, by the way<WH1870>. But David<WH1732> lived<WH3427> in the wilderness<WH4057>, and he saw<WH7200> that Saul<WH7586> came<WH935> after<WH310> him into the wilderness<WH4057>.
David<WH1732> therefore sent out<WH7971> spies<WH7270>, and understood<WH3045> that Saul<WH7586> was come<WH935> in very deed<WH3559>.

And David<WH1732> arose<WH6965>, and came<WH935> to the place<WH4725> where Saul<WH7586> had pitched<WH2583>: and David<WH1732> looked<WH7200> the place<WH4725> where Saul<WH7586> lay<WH7901>, and Abner<WH74> the son<WH1121> of Ner<WH5369>, the captain<WH8269> of his army<WH6635>: and Saul<WH7586> lay<WH7901> in the trench<WH4570>, and the people<WH5971> pitched<WH2583> round about him<WH5439>.

Then answered<WH6030> David<WH1732> and said<WH559> to Ahimelech<WH288> the Hittite<WH2850>, and to Abishai<WH52> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870>, brother<WH251> to Joab<WH3097>, saying<WH559>, Who will go down<WH3381> with me to Saul<WH7586> to the camp<WH4264>? And Abishai<WH52> said<WH559>, I will go down with you<WH3381>.

So David<WH1732> and Abishai<WH52> came<WH935> to the people<WH5971> by night<WH3915>: and<WH7586>, behold, Saul lay<WH7901> sleeping<WH3463> inside the trench<WH4570>, and his spear<WH2595> stuck<WH4600> in the ground<WH776> at his head rest<WH4763>: but Abner<WH74> and the people<WH5971> lay<WH7901> round about him<WH5439>.

Then said<WH559> Abishai<WH52> to David<WH1732>, God<WH430> has delivered<WH5462> your enemy<WH341> into your hand<WH3027> this day<WH3117>: now therefore let me strike<WH5221> him<WH2595>, I pray you, with the spear even to the earth<WH776> at once<WH6471>, and I will not strike him the second time<WH8138>.
And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abishai<WH52>, Destroy<WH7843> him not<WH7971>: for who can stretch forth his hand<WH3027> against the Lord<WH3068>'s anointed<WH4899>, and be guiltless<WH5352>?

David<WH1732> said<WH559> furthermore<WH3068>, As the Lord lives<WH2416>, the Lord<WH3068> shall strike<WH5062> him<WH3117>; or his day shall come<WH935> to die<WH4191>; or he shall descend<WH3381> into battle<WH4421>, and perish<WH5595>.

The Lord<WH3068> forbid<WH2486> that I should stretch forth<WH7971> my hand<WH3027> against the Lord<WH3068>'s anointed<WH4899>: but<WH3947>, I pray you, take you now the spear<WH2595> that is at his head rest<WH4763>, and the jar<WH6835> of water<WH4325>, and let us go<WH3212>.

So David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the spear<WH2595> and the jar<WH6835> of water<WH4325> from Saul<WH7586>'s head rest<WH7226>; and they went them away<WH3212>, and no man saw<WH7200> it<WH3045>, nor knew it<WH6974>, neither awaked: for they were all asleep<WH3463>; because a deep sleep<WH8639> from the Lord<WH3068> was fallen upon them<WH5307>.
Then David<WH1732> went over<WH5674> to the other side<WH5676>, and stood<WH5975> on the top<WH7218> of an hill<WH2022> afar off<WH7350>; a great<WH7227> space being between them<WH4725>:

And David<WH1732> cried<WH7121> to the people<WH5971>, and to Abner<WH74> the son<WH1121> of Ner<WH5369>, saying<WH559>, Answer<WH6030> you not<WH74>, Abner? Then Abner<WH74> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Who are you that cry<WH7121> to the king<WH4428>?

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abner<WH74>, Are not you a valiant man<WH376>? and who is like to you in Israel<WH3478>? why then have you not kept<WH8104> your lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>? for there came<WH935> one<WH259> of the people<WH5971> in to destroy<WH7843> the king<WH4428> your lord<WH113>.

This thing<WH1697> is not good<WH2896> that you have done<WH6213>. As the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>, you are worthy<WH1121> to die<WH4194>, because you have not kept<WH8104> your master<WH113>, the Lord<WH3068>'s anointed<WH4899>. And now see<WH7200> where the king<WH4428>'s spear<WH2595> is<WH6835>, and the jar of water<WH4325> that was at his head rest<WH4763>.

And Saul<WH7586> knew<WH5234> David<WH1732>'s voice<WH6963>, and said<WH559>, Is this your voice<WH6963>, my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>? And David<WH1732> said<WH559>, It is my voice<WH6963>, my lord<WH113>, O king<WH4428>.
And he said<WH559>, Why does my lord<WH113> thus pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> his servant<WH5650>? for what have I done<WH6213>? or what evil<WH7451> is in my hand<WH3027>?

Now therefore<WH113>, I pray you, let my lord the king<WH4428> hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of his servant<WH5650>. If the Lord<WH3068> have stirred you up<WH5496> against me<WH7306>, let him accept an offering<WH4503>: but if they be the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>, cursed<WH779> be they before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068>; for they have driven<WH1644> me out this day<WH3117> from abiding<WH5596> in the inheritance<WH5159> of the Lord<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, Go<WH3212>, serve<WH5647> other<WH312> gods<WH430>.

Now therefore<WH1818>, let not my blood fall<WH5307> to the earth<WH776> before the face<WH6440> of the Lord<WH3068>: for the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> is come out<WH3318> to seek<WH1245> a<WH259> flea<WH6550>, as when one does hunt<WH7291> a partridge<WH7124> in the mountains<WH2022>.

Then said<WH559> Saul<WH7586>, I have sinned<WH2398>: return<WH7725>, my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>: for I will no more do you harm<WH7489>, because my soul<WH5315> was precious<WH3365> in your eyes<WH5869> this day<WH3117>: behold<WH5528>, I have played the fool, and have erred<WH7686> exceedingly<WH7235>.
And David<WH1732> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Behold the king<WH4428>'s spear<WH2595>! and let one<WH259> of the young men<WH5288> come over<WH5674> and fetch it<WH3947>.

The Lord<WH3068> render<WH7725> to every man<WH376> his righteousness<WH6666> and his faithfulness<WH530>: for the Lord<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> you into my hand<WH3027> to day<WH3117>, but I would<WH14> not stretch forth<WH7971> my hand<WH3027> against the Lord<WH3068>'s anointed<WH4899>.

And<WH5315>, behold, as your life was much set by<WH1431> this day<WH3117> in my eyes<WH5869>, so let my life<WH5315> be much set by<WH1431> in the eyes<WH5869> of the Lord<WH3068>, and let him deliver<WH5337> me out of all tribulation<WH6869>.

Then Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Blessed<WH1288> be you<WH1121>, my son David<WH1732>: you shall both do<WH6213> great<WH6213> things<WH3201>, and also shall still prevail<WH3201>. So David<WH1732> went<WH3212> on his way<WH1870>, and Saul<WH7586> returned<WH7725> to his place<WH4725>.
